subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily. And ye are complete in Him. (Colossians 2:9,10)
reflection: All the attributes of Christ, as God and man, are at our disposal. All the fullness of the Godhead, whatever that wonderful term may bring to mind, is ours to make us complete. He cannot endow us with the attributes of Deity; but He has done all that can be done, for He has made even His divine power and Godhead subservient to our salvation. He did it all-He Himself said it When He said on the cross-It is finished
original_content:
May 18


Today's Blessing

"In Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily. 

And ye are complete in Him."
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=Col+2%3A9-10> Colossians 2:9,10

All the attributes of Christ, as God and man, are at our disposal. All the
fullness of the Godhead, whatever that wonderful term may bring to mind, is
ours to make us complete. He cannot endow us with the attributes of Deity;
but He has done all that can be done, for He has made even His divine power
and Godhead subservient to our salvation.

He did it all-He Himself said it When He said on the cross-"It is finished"

Thank You Lord

Pastor Al

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: All have sinned and fall short of God's gracious standard. (Ro. 3:23)
reflection: Agreed-some sins seem bigger than others because their obvious consequences Are much more serious. Murder for example seems to us to be worse than hatred, And adultery seems worse than pride. BUT this does not mean that because we only Commit "little" sins we deserve eternal life. ALL SINS makes us sinners, AND ALL SINS Cut us off from our holy God. So all sins lead to death-(because they disqualify us from living with God) regardless of how great or small they seem. SO don't minimize "little" sins or overrate "big" Sins. They all separate us from God, But they all can be forgiven!
original_content:

Food for thought

only

Commit "little" sins we deserve eternal life. ALL SINS makes us sinners,

So all sins lead to death-(because they disqualify us from living with God)
regardless

We are not living in (Glenwood, Mn.)

I have started Sunday Morning Services here.

We live in an apt. which has about 48 apts.

We love it here it is like we been here forever.

We are on the 3rd floor and our livingroom window

Faces the lake, which is only about 8 or 10 blocks away.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Show me Your unfailing love in wonderful ways. You save with Your strength those who seek refuge From their enemies. (Ps. 17:7)
reflection: Yes God will save us-BUT let us not conclude, that we have somehow missed God's protection if we experience troubles. God's protection has far greater purposes than helping us avoid pain; it is to make us better servants for Him. God also protects us by guiding us through painful circumstances, not only by helping us escape them.
original_content:

Show me Your unfailing love in wonderful ways.

You save with Your strength those who seek refuge 

From their enemies. . . Ps. 17:7



Food For Thought:



Yes God will save us-BUT let us not conclude, that we have somehow

missed God's protection if we experience troubles. God's protection has

far greater purposes than helping us avoid pain; it is to make us better

servants for Him. 

God also protects us by guiding us through painful circumstances, not

only by helping us escape them. . .



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Our Father who art in Heaven. Lk. 11:2
reflection: How simple, and how beautiful, this invocation is which Christ puts upon our lips! And yet how inconceivably rich these words are in their meaning. How full of the love and blessing they contain. Just think what a book could be written of all the memories that there are on earth of wise and loving fathers. Just think of what this world owes to the fathers who have made their children strong and happy in giving their lives to seek the welfare of their fellowmen. And then think how all this is but a shadow-a shadow of beauty beyond compare, but still but a shadow-of what the Father in heaven is to His children on earth. . . What a gift Christ bestowed upon us when He gave us the right to say: "Father!" "The Father of Christ!" "Our Father!" "My Father!" What a privilege is ours when we bow in worship to know that the our heavenly Father comes near to us where we are upon the earth. What a wonderful gift!

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Paul's prayer for his people) "I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally. (Col. 2:1)
reflection: Something we may give very little thought to is: "Prayer is sacrifice. " Our prayer has its worth alone from being rooted in the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. As He gave up everything in His prayer: "Thy will be done, " Our posture and disposition must be the offering up of everything to God in His service. Need we wonder at the lack of power in our prayer where there is So much reluctance to make the needful sacrifice in waiting upon God?
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus: help us to learn that the secret of powerful prayer Is sacrifice-sacrifice of ease-of time-and of self. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Col. 2:1

(Paul's prayer for his people)

"I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at 

Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally."



Today's Lesson:

Something we may give very little thought to is: "Prayer is sacrifice."

Our prayer has its worth alone from being rooted in the sacrifice of

Jesus Christ. As He gave up everything in His prayer: "Thy will be done,"

Our posture and disposition must be the offering up of everything to

God in His service.

Need we wonder at the lack of power in our prayer where there is

So much reluctance to make the needful sacrifice in waiting upon

God?



Today's Prayer:

Dear Lord Jesus: help us to learn that the secret of powerful prayer

Is sacrifice-sacrifice of ease-of time-and of self. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse:
The Lord will work out his plans for my life- for your faithful love,

O Lord, endures forever. Don't abandon me, for you made me. (Ps. 138:8)
reflection: I believe every person dreams and makes plans for the future. Then they work hard to make their dreams and plans come true. But to make the most of life, we need to include God's plan in Our plans. He alone knows what is best for us; He alone can Fulfill His purpose for us.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 138:8



The Lord will work out his plans for my life- for your faithful love,

O Lord, endures forever. Don't abandon me, for you made me.



Food for thought:

I believe every person dreams and makes plans for the future.

Then they work hard to make their dreams and plans come true.



But to make the most of life, we need to include God's plan in

Our plans. He alone knows what is best for us; He alone can

Fulfill His purpose for us. . .



As you make plans and dream dreams-talk with God about it.



We've been asked how we are doing-well we love it here-but I'm

Waiting for the weather to straighten up so I can go fishing. Lake

Minnewaska is only 8 or 10 blocks away. Every time I look out the 

Living-room window I see the lake.



It's kind of like putting a bottle of booze in front of an alcoholic ha-ha



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I cried out to Him for help, praising Him as I spoke. If I had not confessed the sin in my heart, my Lord would not have listened-But God did listen! (Ps. 66:17, 18, 19a)
reflection: Our confession of sin must be continual-because we continue to do wrong. But true confession requires us to listen to God and want to stop doing what Is wrong. . . David confessed his sin and prayed-"Cleanse me from these hidden faults, Keep me from deliberate sins" (ps. 19:12, 13). When we refuse to repent, or when we labor and cherish certain sins, we Place a wall between us and God. We may not be able to remember every sin obedience.
original_content:
Today's Verse: ." Ps. 66:17, 18, 19a

I cried out to Him for help, praising Him as I spoke.

If I had not confessed the sin in my heart, my Lord 

would not have listened-But God did listen!

Food for Thought:

Our confession of sin must be continual-because we continue to do wrong.

But true confession requires us to listen to God and want to stop doing what

Is wrong. . .

David confessed his sin and prayed-"Cleanse me from these hidden faults,

Keep me from deliberate sins" (ps. 19:12, 13).

When we refuse to repent, or when we labor and cherish certain sins, we

Place a wall between us and God. We may not be able to remember every sin

We have committed, but our attitude should be one of confession and
obedience.

****************************************************************************

It is about 15 miles south of Alexandrea Mn. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Don't think you are better than you really are. Be honest in your evaluation of yourselves, measuring yourselves by the faith God has given us. (Ro. 12:3b)
reflection: Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think too little of ourselves; on the other hand. Some of us over-estimate ourselves-the key to an honest and accurate self-evaluation is knowing the basis of our self-worth-our identity in Christ. Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him, capable of worthy service. Evaluating ourselves by the worldly standards of success and achievements can cause us to think too much about our worth in the eyes of others and so miss our true value in God's eyes.
original_content:

measuring yourselves by the faith God has given us. . .

self-evaluation is knowing

the basis of our self-worth-our identity in Christ. . .



Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him,
we are valuable and 

capable of worthy service. . .



Evaluating ourselves by the worldly standards of success and achievements
can cause us to think too

much about our worth in the eyes of others and so miss our true value in
God's eyes. . .

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Seek the Lord while you can find him. Call on him now while he is near. (Isaiah 55:6)
reflection: Isaiah tells us to call on the Lord while he is near. God is not planning to move away from us, but we often move far from Him or erect barriers of sin between us. Don't wait until you have drifted far away from God to seek Him. Turning to Him may be far more difficult later in life. Or God may come to judge the earth before you decide to turn to Him. Seek God now, while you can, before it is too late. . .
original_content:
Today's Verse: 55:6 

Seek the Lord while you can find him. Call on him now while he is near.



Thoughts to live by:

Isaiah tells us to call on the Lord while he is near. God is not planning to
move away 

from us, but we often move far from Him or erect barriers of sin between us.




Don't wait until you have drifted far away from God to seek Him. Turning to
Him

may be far more difficult later in life. Or God may come to judge the earth
before

you decide to turn to Him. Seek God now, while you can, before it is too
late. . .



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For who can know the Lord's thoughts? Who knows enough to give him advice? And who has given him so much that he needs to pay it back? (Ro. 11:34, 35)
reflection: The implication of these questions is that no one has fully understood the mind of the Lord. No one has been His counselor. And God owes nothing to anyone of us. . . Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to give advise to God or criticize His ways (Isa 40:13) Jer. 23:18. . . God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ro. 11:34, 35 

For who can know the Lord's thoughts? Who knows enough to give him advice?
And who has given him so much that he needs to pay it back?



Today's Thoughts:

The implication of these questions is that no one has fully understood the
mind

of the Lord. No one has been His counselor. And God owes nothing to anyone

of us. . .

Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to
give

advise to God or criticize His ways (Isa 40:13) Jer. 23:18. . .



God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom. . .



My prayer is that you all had a safe and blessed Memorial Day.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Whom He justified, them He also glorified (Romans 8:30)
reflection: Here is a precious truth for the believer. You may be poor, or in suffering, or unknown, but there is encouragement for you if you review your "calling." As surely as you are God's child today, so surely shall all your trials soon be at an end, and you shall be rich to all the intents of God's grace. Wait awhile, and that weary head shall wear the crown of glory, and that hand of labor shall grasp the palm-branch of victory. Don't cry over your troubles, but instead rejoice that one day you will be where "there shall be neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain." Remember the portals of heaven stand open for you. If He has called you, nothing can separate you from His love. Distress cannot sever the bond; the fire of persecution cannot burn the link; the hammer of hell cannot break the chain. You are secure; that voice which called you at first, shall call you yet again from earth to heaven, from death's dark gloom to immortality's unuttered splendors. Rest assured, the heart of Him who has justified you beats with infinite love towards you. You shall soon be with the glorified, where your portion is
prayer: Dear Lord, we look forward to the day when from this world of grief and sin, we will be united with You and be eternally shut-in-where we will rest for never and ever. . .Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Romans 8:30
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=Ro+8%3A30> Whom He justified,
them He also glorified



Today's Promise:

Here is a precious truth for the believer. You may be poor, or in suffering,
or unknown, but there is encouragement for you if you review your "calling."
As surely as you are God's child today, so surely shall all your trials soon
be at an end, and you shall be rich to all the intents of God's grace. 

Wait awhile, and that weary head shall wear the crown of glory, and that
hand of labor shall grasp the palm-branch of victory. Don't cry over your
troubles, but instead rejoice that one day you will be where "there shall be
neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain."

Remember the portals of heaven stand open for you. If He has called you,
nothing can separate you from His love. Distress cannot sever the bond; the
fire of persecution cannot burn the link; the hammer of hell cannot break
the chain. You are secure; that voice which called you at first, shall call
you yet again from earth to heaven, from death's dark gloom to immortality's
unuttered splendors.

Rest assured, the heart of Him who has justified you beats with infinite
love towards you. You shall soon be with the glorified, where your portion
is.



Prayer: Dear Lord, we look forward to the day when from this world of
grief and sin,

we will be united with You and be eternally shut-in-where we will rest
for 

ever and ever. . .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

."

subject: thoughts to live by
verse:
Devote yourselves to prayer with an alert mind and
a thankful heart. (Col. 4:2)
reflection: This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs to be one with the will to take the time to do some serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of Christ in which we belong. BUT once we begin, we will find numerous reasons for the persevering and yielding to the Holy Spirit-that He may fit us for the great and blessed work of day by day praying the twofold prayer, for the love of God and Christ to fill the hearts of His people and for the power of the Holy Spirit to come down and accomplish God's work in this sinful world.
prayer: Dear Lord, may we devote ourselves to daily prayer-Fill our hearts with a love for God and ChristSend to us the power of the Holy Spirit to be able to accomplish Your work in this sinful world. Amen
original_content:

This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs to be one with the
will to take the time to 

do some serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of
Christ in which we

belong. . .

BUT once we begin, we will find numerous reasons for the persevering and
yielding to the Holy

Spirit-that He may fit us for the great and blessed work of day by day
praying the twofold prayer, 

for the love of God and Christ to fill the hearts of His people and for the
power of the Holy Spirit

to come down and accomplish God's work in this sinful world. . .



Prayer:

Dear Lord, may we devote ourselves to daily prayer-Fill our hearts with a
love for God and ChristSend to us the power of the Holy Spirit to be able to accomplish Your work
in this sinful world. . . Amen





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved. For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God, and it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved (Ro 10:9-10)
reflection: Have you ever been asked-"How do I become a Christian?" These verse give you a beautiful answer. Salvation is as close as your lips and your heart. It seems as though many people think it must be a Complicated proccess, but it is not. If we believe in our heart, and say with our mouth that Christ is the risen Lord. We will be saved. As we grow-A Christian should beA mind through which Christ thinksA voice through which Christ speaks a heart through which Christ lovesA hand through which Christ helps. . .
original_content:
Today's Scripture: Ro 10:9-10

If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart
that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God, and
it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved



Today's Lesson:

Have you ever been asked-"How do I become a Christian?" These verse give you
a beautiful answer.

Salvation is as close as your lips and your heart. It seems as though many
people think it must be a 

Complicated proccess, but it is not. 

If we believe in our heart, and say with our mouth that Christ is the risen
Lord. We will be saved.



As we grow-A Christian should beA mind through which Christ thinksA voice through which Christ speaksA heart through which Christ lovesA hand through which Christ helps. . .



Have a blessed week end! ! !



I will be away from the computor for five days

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather
